title: Ticket #347: Enable MPI jobs on Windows
description: Find a way to run the MPI job "monitor" as something other than a service on Windows.
remarks:
The command-line: 

  smpd.exe -anyport

Will do the job. It's even kind enough to spit out the port number it has chosen on standard output.

2009-Mar-24 17:30:43 by gthain:
Have you tested this? The documentation says that all smpds must use the same port?

2009-Mar-24 17:36:34 by gthain:
This is interesting:

The Folding@home SMP client initially used the MPICH2 implementation of MPI for the Linux, Mac OS X and Windows SMP clients, to enable multiple Folding@home cores to cooperate. Since v5.92 the Windows client stopped using MPICH2 in favor of DeinoMPI which runs much more reliable on Windows (like MPICH2 does on Linux and Mac OS X). The Linux & Mac OS X clients still use MPICH2. See: Folding Forum: kasson in New Windows SMP client release

2009-Mar-25 11:17:43 by burnett:
Running jobs then requires the host name and the port name: 

  mpiexec.exe -n 4 -host Agrajag.cs.wisc.edu -p 60141 ..\examples\cpi.exe

Assuming 60141 is the correct port number.
